poem:
"Season of the Shoulder"

In this time of fall collars and vanishing cleavage,
Ask not where the neckline drops, but rather where the shoulder peeks.
A canvas of winter-pale skin, icy as memory,
Attempting allure in the cool air. 
Wear your age as an ornament, not a shroud, my dear,
In the mirror, where lotions and potions play tricks,
Show your shoulder season to time, unchanged by fear.
